details.title: Chhattisgarh polls first phase starts today
details.content: Amidst boycott call by the rebels, 18 Assembly constituencies of 90 is going for the first phase of polls in Naxal-affected Chhattisgarh.

details.title: Polling to begin at 7 AM
details.content: Polling in 13 constituencies, where there is substantial Maoist presence, will be from 7 AM to 3 PM. Polling in five constituencies will be from 8 AM to 5 PM.

Visuals from a polling station in Dantewada ahead of the first phase of voting in #ChhattisgarhAssemblyElections2018 today. pic.twitter.com/XD83OaM5cm

— ANI (@ANI) November 12, 2018

details.title: Heavy security deployment for first phase polls
details.content: A total of 650 companies (roughly around 65,000 security personnel), including CRPF, BSF, ITBP and other state forces, have been sent by the Centre for poll duty. These units are apart from the paramilitary personnel and 200 companies of state forces already engaged in the anti- Maoist operations in Chhattisgarh.

details.title: Voting begins for 10 out of 18 seats in first phase of polling
details.content:
#Chhattisgarh: Voting begins for 10 out of 18 seats in the first phase of #ChhattisgarhAssemblyElection2018 pic.twitter.com/n3mXyn4Nhd

— ANI (@ANI) November 12, 2018

details.title: Naxals blast IE Device minutes after polling begins in Tumakpal
details.content: 1-2 kilograms of Improvised Explosive Device (IED) blasted by naxals near Tumakpal camp in Katekalyan block. (ANI)

details.title: Chhattisgarh women don’t get due in poll tickets
details.content:
Women voters outnumber men in 15 districts and in 33 Assembly seats of Chhattisgarh. But, their representation during the previous three elections remained a dismal 9 to 13 per cent — a far cry from the 33 per cent quota in ticket allocation that is often peddled by political parties.

(Click here to read more)

details.title: Voting begins in Rajnandgaon and Bastar
details.content:
Voting to start in 5 constituencies of Rajnandgaon & 3 constituencies of Bastar at 8 am in the first phase of #ChhattisgarhAssemblyElections2018; #Visuals from a polling station in Rajnandgaon pic.twitter.com/Tk2vmlQrL5

— ANI (@ANI) November 12, 2018

details.title: Here are some quick facts about polling in the 'Naxal bastion' of Bastar
details.content:
• Bastar zone Total Seats: 12
  • Polling booths in hyper sensitive areas: 1190
  • Sensitive: 924
  • Politically sensitive 401
  • Booths relocated: 187 in 86 places
  • Forces deployed: Around 60,000
  • Poll Time: 7 am- 3 pm

details.title: Disenchanted with national parties, Bastar tribals seek to send own representative to Assembly
details.content:
The realisation that having decision-making powers in their hands is the only way to check exploitation at the hands of politicians and Maoists has made tribal groups in some of the villages in Bastar to join the poll fray. They have decided to join hands and contest elections to send their representative to the Assembly this time.

The party may not win due to the strong presence of the BJP and the Congress, but is expected to give a tough fight to the candidates of both the national parties. In 2013, it was the shift of Bastar voters to the Congress that had given a scare to the BJP. Of the 12 seats in the region, Congress won 8 while the BJP, which had won 11 seats in 2008, was reduced to 4.

 (Click here to read more)

details.title: 100-year-old woman arrives at a polling station to cast her vote
details.content: A 100-year-old woman reaches a polling station in Dornapal to cast her vote in Sukma. (Photo|ANI)

details.title: Half a dozen chopper and multiple drones deployed to keep tight vigil on the polling booths
details.content: Nearly 900 polling personnel have been air-dropped from helicopters so that they can reach safely. Over 16,500 polling personnel went by-road. I think all will be in a position to deliver peaceful elections: Chief Election Commissioner OP Rawat. (ANI)

details.title: EVM glitch leads to pause in voting in one of Rajnandgaon's polling booth
details.content:
#ChhattisgarhElections2018: Voting has stopped due to technical problem in the EVM at the Pink polling booth in Kamla College, in Rajnandgaon's Sangwari pic.twitter.com/cgrjUCQcga

— ANI (@ANI) November 12, 2018

details.title: PM Narendra Modi asks voters in Chhattisgarh to take part in the electoral process and cast their votes
details.content:
छत्तीसगढ़ में मतदान का आज पहला चरण है। सभी मतदाताओं से मेरा आग्रह है कि वे पूरे उत्साह के साथ लोकतंत्र के महापर्व में अवश्य भाग लें और भारी संख्या में मतदान करें।

— Narendra Modi (@narendramodi) November 12, 2018

details.title: Opinion| In Chhattisgarh, Congress may spring a surprise
details.content:
Since the creation of the state on November 1, 2000, the BJP under the leadership of Raman Singh has ruled it, barring the first three years, when the Congress led by Ajit Jogi ruled the state. Thereafter, factionalism in the Congress in the state couldn’t withstand the clean image and settled leadership of incumbent chief minister Raman Singh, whose populist ‘rice politics’ just before the 2008 Assembly election returned the BJP to power for another term.

(Click here to read more)

details.title: Ban on liquor, interest-free loans, almost free rice and a 'Naxal-free' state, political parties have bet it all this election season
details.content:
Ban on liquor, interest-free loans, almost free rice and a 'Naxal-free' state -- political parties have tried every trick in the book to outdo each other with their poll promises as the state goes to polls with Maoist-affected areas of Chhattisgarh for a multi-phased poll season across five states.

While Chhattisgarh has traditionally seen a direct fight between the BJP and the Congress, a third force has emerged this time in the form of an alliance between former Congress chief minister Ajit Jogi's own party Janata Congress Chhattisgarh and Dalit leader Mayawati's Bahujan Samaj Party.

details.title: Visually challenged man casts his vote in Dantewada
details.content:
#ChhattisgarhElections2018: A visually impaired person casts his vote at a polling station in Dantewada's Geedam pic.twitter.com/1ZtBqolhiM

— ANI (@ANI) November 12, 2018

details.title: IED  detected near a polling booth in Konta's Banda
details.content: An IED was detected near a polling booth in Konta's Banda. (Photo| ANI)

details.title: Voters in tribal area of Sukma district queue up to cast their votes amid tight security
details.content: Tribal voters in queue under the watchful eyes of security forces at Sukma. (Photo| EPS)

details.title: 10.7% voter turnout recorded till 10 am
details.content: 10.7% voter turnout recorded till 10 am in the first phase of elections in 18 constituencies. (ANI)

details.title: EVM snag in Kanker, Rajnandgaon, Jagdalpur, polling delayed in Bijapur, Narayanpur and south Bastar
details.content:
In around a dozen polling stations the voting was interrupted owing to technical glitches in the electronic voting machines (EVMs). During the first couple of hours, the voting percentage was around 15 per cent in various seats.

The EVM snag was reported in Kanker, Rajnandgaon, Jagdalpur, Bhanupratapur and polling was delayed by an hour in Bijapur, Narayanpur and south Bastar.

details.title: Man taking his father to a polling station in Dantewada
details.content: A man taking his father in a wheelchair to a polling station at Ronje panchayat in Dantewada. (Photo| EPS)

details.title: CM Raman Singh, who is also in fray today,  urges people of Chhattisgarh to vote in large numbers
details.content:
आज हमारे छत्तीसगढ़ में भारतीय लोकतांत्रिक व्यवस्था का महापर्व है। आप सभी युवाओं, महिलाओं और वरिष्ठजनों से मेरा यह आग्रह है कि छत्तीसगढ़ विधानसभा चुनाव-2018 के प्रथम चरण में आप सभी अपने मताधिकार का प्रयोग अवश्य करें। आपका मतदान ही राष्ट्र की ताकत है।

— Dr Raman Singh (@drramansingh) November 12, 2018

details.title: Huge voter turnout despite call for ban by Maoists
details.content:
Rajnandgaon: Huge voter turnout (pic 1) at the polling station in Naxal-affected Manpur's Pardoni village where Naxali posters & banners (pic 2 & 3) asking people to boycott elections had been seen. #ChhattisgarhAssemblyElections2018 pic.twitter.com/Ld5SJEPnAX

— ANI (@ANI) November 12, 2018

details.title: In Chhattisgarh, BJP sets its poll hopes on ‘Raman raj’
details.content:
The ruling BJP in Chhattisgarh has tailored its campaign around ‘Raman par vishwas, Kamal sang vikas’ — its slogan in the poll-bound state. Despite having a weak political team at his disposal, Singh’s image continues to tower above all else and a stable government on his watch has ensured the party is on a strong footing in its bid to win a fresh mandate.

(CLICK HERE TO READ MORE)

details.title: 16.24% voter turnout recorded till 11 am
details.content: 16.24 per cent overall voter turnout recorded till 11 am in the first phase of elections in 18 constituencies.

details.title: Voters in Jagdalpur's protest outside the polling centre owing to missing names in voter list
details.content:
#ChhattisgarhAssemblyElections2018: Voters in Jagdalpur's Gandhi Nagar ward protest outside the polling centre, say, "The names of many voters are missing including those who have been living here for the past 25 years." pic.twitter.com/AGri8PE626

— ANI (@ANI) November 12, 2018

details.title: PM Narendra Modi addresses poll rally in Chhattisgarh's  Bilaspur, says have 'confidence in people of Chhattisgarh'
details.content:
Prime Minister Narendra Modi kick-started the campaign for the second phase of Assembly election in Chhattisgarh on Monday. While addressing a poll rally in Bilaspur, he said,"BJP has blessings of people, Chhattisgarh has given the party several oppertunities to serve the state". He urged people to set a new voting record.

Bilaspur goes to polls on November 20.

details.title: You can witness development wherever you go in Chhattisgarh: PM Modi in Chhattisgarh
details.content: Voters should go by the the mantra 'Phele matdaan phir jalpaan.Our opposition still don’t know how to fight the BJP. We are focused on development, we went beyond the caste divisions. You can witness development wherever you go in Chhattisgarh: PM Modi addressing a rally in Bilaspur.

details.title: Encounter underway between security forces & Naxals in Bijapur
details.content:
Two commando Battalion for Resolute Action (CoBRA) jawan injured in an encounter that broke out between security forces & Naxals in Bijapur's Pamed area at around 12:20 pm today. Firing underway (ANI)

More details awaited

details.title: Bijapur encounter: Two Cobra men injured, reinforcement deployed
details.content: According to the Bijapur police a team of Cobra were on out on area domination when the Maoists opened fire on the troopers. The attack was retaliated by the forces. “In an exchange of fire one assistant sub-inspector and a constable sustained injuries and the efforts are on to evacuate them to safety. The forces are still inside the forest”, the police said.

details.title: 25. 15 % voter turn out recorded till 1pm
details.content: 25.15 per cent voter turnout recorded till 1 pm in the first phase of Chhattisgarh Assembly Elections.

details.title: Despite multiple boycott calls, people in Dantewada came out to exercise their electoral rights
details.content:
#Chhattisgarh: People in Dantewada's Madenda village cast their votes even after threat from the Naxals to cut their fingers if the ink mark is seen on their fingers. Local says, "there are 263 registered voters in the village and many are voting even after the threat." pic.twitter.com/WPDYX9OiEs

— ANI (@ANI) November 12, 2018

details.title: We assured villagers of secure voting environment: CRPF
details.content: After the Nilwaya naxal attack, the challenges have gone up. Naxals had threatened villagers against voting. We assured the villagers of a secure environment, put in place a three level security so that people can vote without fear: CRPF official

details.title: 47.18% voter turn out recorded till 3pm
details.content: 47.18 per cent voter turnout recorded till 3 pm in the first phase of Assembly elections.

details.content:

Jagdalpur: 54% Chitrakot: 57% Mohala-Manpur: 67%

details.title: Five Naxals gunned down in Bijapur encounter
details.content: Five Naxals killed, three more personnel of Commando Battalion for Resolute Action (CoBRA) were injured in the encounter that broke out between security forces & Naxals in Bijapur's Pamed area today. All the CoBRA personnel are out danger. (ANI)
